taskGroup.name: Visualisation with g-Eclipse
taskGroup.intro:
This set of cheat sheets will show you how to use g-Eclipse to visualise scientific data sets, computed on the Grid.
You can select a task to work on, either by following the hyperlinks offered below, or by selecting a task after expanding the tree above.
taskGroup.onCompletion: Congratulations! You have learned how to visualise scientific data from within g-Eclipse.

taskGroup.name: Defining the VTK Pipeline
taskGroup.intro: First, you will learn how to create the VTK Pipeline file and set its content.
taskGroup.onCompletion: Congratulations! You have learned how to use the VTK Pipeline file creation wizard and the pipeline editor.

task.name: Creating VTK Pipeline File
task.intro: This cheatsheet describes the steps in creating VTK Pipeline file.
task.onCompletion: Congratulations! You have successfully created a VTK Pipeline file.

task.name: Specifying VTK Pipeline Content
task.intro: This cheatsheet explanes how to set the content of the VTK Pipeline.
task.onCompletion: Congratulation! You have successfully specified the content of your VTK Pipeline.

taskGroup.name: Rendering
taskGroup.intro: Next, you will learn about the two ways of rendering your data using g-Eclipse.
taskGroup.onCompletion: Congratulations! You have learned how you can use g-Eclipse to render your data.

task.name: Local Rendering
task.intro: Here you will learn how to visualise data processed and rendered on your local computer.
task.onCompletion: Congratulation! You have learned how to use g-Eclipse to visualise scientific data sets, processed and rendered on your local computer.

task.name: Remote Rendering
task.intro: Here you will learn how to run the rendering job on a remote machine and visualise the results on your local computer.
task.onCompletion: Congratulation! You have learned how to visualise remotely rendered data from within g-Eclipse.
